trial_identification.studytitle: Effects of aldosterone blockade in hypertrophic cardiomyopathy
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Anti-fibrotic role of eplerenone on diffuse myocardial fibrosis and diastolic function in patients with hypertrophic cardiomyopathy

interventions.interventions: Eplerenone 50mg orally once daily for 12 months
interventions.comparator: Placebo (identical to eplerenone 50mg orally once daily for 12 months but without the active ingredient)

primaryOutcome.outcome: Difference in quantification of diffuse myocardial fibrosis as assessed with cardiac magnetic resonance imaging
primaryOutcome.timepoint: 12 months after commencement of eplerenone or placebo

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Difference in diastolic function as assessed with echocardiography
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: 12 months after commencement of eplerenone or placebo

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Functional status as assessed by New York Heart Association (NYHA) class and 6 minute walk test
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: 12 months after commencement of eplerenone or placebo

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Confirmed diagnosis of hypertrophic cardiomyopathy Ability to swallow pills Not pregnant
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Contra-indication to cardiac MRI, including administration of gadolinium-based IV contrast Co-existing cardiac condition with may contribute to myocardial fibrosis Unable to take aldosterone antagonist
